resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
kou opened a new pull request, #12795:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12795

   `find_package(gRPC)` may find system `absl::*` targets.
   If we found system `absl::*` targets, we use them instead of building `absl::*`.

kou commented on PR #12795:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12795#issuecomment-1091255488

   @emkornfield Do you want to merge this before #12763 is merged or after? This will be conflicted with #12763.
   
   This will be ready to merge once https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/5864515682?check_suite_focus=true is passed.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
cpp/cmake_modules/FindgRPCAlt.cmake somehow exposes the same libraries defined in build_absl_once (defined in cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake) causing CMake to fail when GCS client is enabled for building.

I tried playing around with various options but given my limited CMake skills I could not figure out an easy solution to this.
fields.summary: [C++] Builds that use cpp/cmake_modules/FindgRPCAlt.cmake cannot build GCS support

comments.body: This affects mingw and os/x CI builds.
Could you share an URL for one of the CI builds?

https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/5775653588?check_suite_focus=true is an example of the failing build.  

https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12763 is the PR that I ran into this issue (switching the releveant builds to keep GCS off for the time being.
